int.name: path_dist_diffuse_multiplier
int.help: Diffuse ray multiplier for the PathDistributed integrator

int.name: path_dist_glossy_multiplier
int.help: Glossy ray multiplier for the PathDistributed integrator

int.name: enable_volumetrics
int.help: Enable the Volumetrics integrator. Needed for SSS and volumes.

int.name: light_samples
int.help: The number of light samples to use per pixel sample.

int.name: spp
int.help: The overall number of samples per pixel. Perfect square numbers (49, 64, 144) will give slightly better sample stratification.

int.name: iterations
int.help: The number of iteration passes to split the above samples into

int.name: fast_live_renders
int.help: Use a smaller number of samples per pixel for live renders, making each iteration much faster.

int.name: flip_t
int.help: Flip the t (V) coordinate of st texture coordinates.

int.name: enable_subdivision
int.help: Enable using subdivision surfaces. With this off, subdmesh types will be interpreted as standard polygons.

int.name: bake_down_scene
int.help: Whether to bake down the scene to one single acceleration structure. Build time is longer and uses more memory, and doesn't support instancing or transform motion blur, but intersection time can be drastically reduced when there are lots of overlapping objects.

int.name: specialise_assembly_types
int.help: Detect locations of assembly type and interpret them as Compound Objects. This can speed up rendering complex objects with overlapping geometry objects significantly.

int.name: deduplicate_vertex_normals
int.help: de-duplicate per-vertex normals for meshes. Build time is longer (and peak memory is higher), but can reduce final memory usage significantly in some cases.

int.name: scene_accel_structure
int.help: Scene acceleration type to use. KDTree is generally faster for more sparse scenes with lots of empty space. For dense scenes with lots of overlapping objects, BVH can be significantly faster.
